website_summaries.verdict: It has some nice features and some flaws, including the small grass catcher that isn't an ideal mulch system.
pros: Large front wheels and long, contoured handle for leverage
cons: The mulching system doesn't hold much grass
Design is a bit bulky and difficult to store
Running over tough sticks and branches could bend the blade

customer_reviews.title: Lawn mowing with human power~
customer_reviews.text: I was familiar with push mowers from many years ago so decided I would purchase this one. It seems to be well-made. It requires a minimal amount of time to put together. The grass catcher is not helpful. It just clips on the back of the mower and if it bumps on the ground, while mowing, it pops off. Eventually I just removed it. The only other issue to remember is this is a rotary blade and every twig will cause it to stop. This can be mitigated by raking the lawn before cutting it to remove the sticks and twigs.
customer_reviews.author: Jill A Shade

customer_reviews.title: wheels locked up after 5 yards of mowing
customer_reviews.text: I put this piece of s*** together yesterday, the wheels locked up after 10 yards and just got stuck, you can back up but won't move forward. 30 mn wait for customer support, no one answered. returning. I'll buy from Home Depot moving forward, at least I know there is someone to talk to in case of a problem with a product. Also this thing was hard to push, I would have probably returned it just for that.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This was heavier than the lawn mower I bought to replace it. This was pretty funny to try! Price point isn’t bad, if you had perfect sod this could work for you. It was easy to assemble, but awkward and heavy to push. This is a hard no, but at least I probably gave a few of my neighbors a great laugh wondering what the hell I was doing. I gave Up in about 2 minutes. My boyfriend then took over and lasted about another 5 minutes trying to prove to me it really wasn’t that hard. Dumb dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Product is Discontinued!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel mower and used it for the first time. I loved the way it cut the longer grass and the catcher caught almost all of the clippings. However, during the first use one of the housing for the height adjustment cracked. I called greenworks to get a new clip and they informed me that the product has been discontinued and no replacement parts are available. I was told to check online to see if I could find the part that was needed. So much for the 4 year manufacture's warranty.
customer_reviews.author: jhle1

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 times of mowing my lawn.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this lawn mower for 3 months, which means that I only mowed my front lawn 6 times. On the 6th time, this morning, the blades chose to not work anymore. They no longer move. I looked at it, and they don't fit in the frame of where the blade is supposed to slice the grass. Now I am out $80 because GreenWorks said that I can only take it back within 60 days. Most stores, even Wal-Mart offer a 90 day replacement if it breaks. I would not suggest anyone buy this unless you have a very very very small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Small yard? Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have a very small yard and didn’t want to spend a ton of money on a mower, so we thought we’d give this a shot. It’s AMAZING. one of my favorite purchases I’ve ever made. It’s so easy to use, really easy to assemble and it is actually kinda fun to mow with. Every time I’m outside mowing people ask me about it because they want to buy one too. I would say that if I did it again I would probably buy the 18 in version instead of 16 in but I’m still beyond happy and it’s working great! Will update this review if anything changes!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: But this one!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a house with a half acre lot we had a gentleman mowing our grass however he was unable to keep us on his schedule due to overbooking. Not wanting our grass to get any higher as it’s been over a month without a cut we decided to do it ourselves. We only cut about 1/4 an acre! Works well will update if things change. Very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: robert richards

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit afraid of the assembly part of this purchase - I should not have worried! It was so easy! The instructions are not the clearest I've seen written, but, the picture diagrams along each step make is rather easy to figure it out. The unit worked so well on cutting my grass too. The cuttings collector did not stay on, I'm not sure if this was poor assembly on my part or shoddy design. I plan to tackled that part again before the next trim. I do highly rate this item.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi's Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Descent for the price, but too many issues
customer_reviews.text: Update: 1 year later and it doesn't cut the grass anymore. I sharpened the blades and adjusted the shield, still won't get through the grass. The tall fescue has really come in this year, and it's thick, so probably why it won't work anymore. Original: Needed some blade adjustment since it wouldn't spin. Also didn't come with any hardware to put together. So I found some bolts in my garage, that would work. Leaf blower works fine. Its ok to cut tall fescue grass, but definitely have to go over spots a couple times. But at least I don't have to deal with gas!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. I bought this mower because I was trying to buy a eco friendly/quiet mower. It worked the first time I used it, it's hard to push if your lawn isn't all level, it would get stuck in grooves and bumps. The second time I used this product the wheels looked up and I was not able to use it from that point on. I took it apart and put it back together and the whole thing was still locked. I'm very upset I wasted my money on this product to only get to use it twice. I will NOT be buying anything else from this product line.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine White

customer_reviews.title: Stuck many times. Only works on short grass.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when using this , if you have small branches on your lawn , it will get stuck. Tiny rocks will get stuck. Only will work in short grass less than 4 inches or it will not cut. If you mow your lawn often , then this is good. But who does it every 2-3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Leong

customer_reviews.title: The Best Lawn Mower I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this push mower. It assembled quickly and easily. Several of the reviews complained about small sticks bogging it down and at first I was having this problem as well. Then I realized that if I used my foot (properly covered in a running shoe) to reach down and pull the blades backward an inch or two - the stick falls right out of the mechanism and I can keep going with hardly a delay. By mowing the lawn by hand I burn about 200 calories, get a great upper and lower body workout - I reduce my environmental footprint and my grass looks amazing. I highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: addictedtoshoes

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: It looked easy enough to assemble until the holes wouldn’t line up to put the bolts through. We tried it several different ways and still ended up with one set of predrilled holes that needed to be drilled again. Blades were very sharp and cut the grass no problem, but about 3/4 Of the way through cutting my very small backyard, the little part where you adjust the height snapped and broke off. So, I essentially got one use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy S.

customer_reviews.title: Bag does not stay.
customer_reviews.text: The bag definitely falls off and I gave less points because I know others had the same issue. I think you pay a tad bit more for something useless. Otherwise it worked good for my yard. I did not want electric because of cords and not used to gas appliances. The back of my yard is 3/4 brick patio and front has grass on both sides if walkway. I did not do the assembly or mowing but heard no complaints or signs of frustration. Update Ran very well. Easy to put together even though directions not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Livelovelearn

customer_reviews.title: It is great for some lawn mowing
customer_reviews.text: This little reel mower may look like very cheap and not up to the task, but it gets the job done. However, I am going to say that this reel mower is not a permanent solution for your lawn mowing. It will definitely come in handy in emergency, but for weekly mowing it is best to get the electric or gasoline mower. If not, you are going to bust or brake this reel mower soon, because it is not build to last. lol...
customer_reviews.author: T. N.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t tell my hubby...
customer_reviews.text: If we would have gotten this sooner I would have taken over lawn mowing! It was very fun for me to use this, and my kids love to help also. This works perfectly for our front and back lawns. I love that it’s sustainable. Some of our skinny weeds end up laying flat because of how the machine works but it definitely makes a big difference and I would definitely recommend getting one!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: I know it'd be a lot better if my yard space were even without any potholes and weeds and all that. It was great the first two times I used it... Then I had a hard two weeks at work and the yard blew up. Now it's too overgrown for the push mower and it doesn't like to be left in the rain, either. WD40 helped with that but I think I might sell it on FB or something and just get an electric weed eater instead.
customer_reviews.author: openshaw_5

customer_reviews.title: Not good for thick hybrid Bermuda
customer_reviews.text: I’m highly disappointed in this mower. It worked well the the first two mowings after the sod was laid. However once my lawn grew in it became impossible to push. I would like to cut my Bermuda low, but not can’t get it to cut on the higher setting. It’s also looks choppy. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: AAouate

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to lawn care
customer_reviews.text: Ships fairly small for what it does. Assembles without tools; just follow manual. The cutting blades are sharp to take care to keep this in mind at all times otherwise very easy to operate. Some noise but nowhere near as loud as a gas unit; video clip captures sound a bit louder than it is while making passes. Overall great purchase, solves my lawn care needs on a great budget AND no fuel trips or forgotten charges to worry about... timeless really.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 16-Inch Reel Lawn Mower works
customer_reviews.text: This lawnmower is perfect for someone who wants to mow their yard and be environmental at the same time. I don't recommend this for lawns bigger than 1/4 acre. It's all manual labor, so expect a workout when you mow your lawn. It was easy to assemble, so that's a major plus. The instructions weren't the greatest, so I suggest going to youtube. There's several excellent vids showing how to put this together. As for the bag that comes with it? I don't use it. It's flimsy beyond belief and I like using the clippings for mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica L. Tudor

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Mower
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son picked this out. They wanted to avoid having to use gas, or oil, or lawn mower noise. We ordered a different one first, but it had lots of problems and had to go back. Hence, we chose this one for the price point and the blower included. Our yard looks amazing. The way it cuts the grass is so much cleaner than the way a gas mower cuts it and leaves jagged edges. Highly recommend this mower.
customer_reviews.author: FiveIves

customer_reviews.title: It cuts well and sometimes wheels get locked
customer_reviews.text: This is something I've seen in other reviews, the wheels sometimes get stuck; I figured that removing the grass that gets stuck and running it in reverse a bit then forward unlocks the wheel; its not a big deal, but sometimes it's frustrating when it happens all of a sudden. Overall its good, kind of light weight, the container fills quickly so there are a lot of stops to dump the grass somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We haven't actually used the blower yet (we don't have sidewalks) but the mower works pretty good over our acre yard. We have to weed whip the grass down at the first of spring or the reel mowers won't cut it. It just bends it over but once it's short it's really easy to keep that way. Love the exercise and not using gas or electricity for the rest of the season 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Placed

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise. Won’t give you a perfect cut, but good enough
customer_reviews.text: Does not seem to cut evenly. Maybe I haven’t mastered the technique, but I can never get the grass as even with a powered mower. I have to go over the same spots twice to get grass that is still sticking up. One positive is that this thing is easy to store compared to a powered mower. Fits easily into a 2x2 vertical shed. The handle and bag easily comes apart, and the mower can store vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Gootie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this mower to work for me. I have a small yard so I didn’t want to spend a ton of money on a lawn mower. Putting this together was easy but when I went to use it the wheels were completely locked up - they would turn only if you pulled the mower towards you but wouldn’t budge going forward. I tried adjusting the height and nothing worked. It’s as if the wheels were put on backwards. I sent an email to the manufacturer on their website and never heard back - poor customer service. I ended up returning it because clearly something was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Petfect for small yard
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely like my new mower. Bought to use on my own small section yard as husband used zero turn on the rest. Easy to use. It does get stuck with small twigs. Husband showed me how to reverse handle and shake twig out without having to bend to touch blades so that took care of only minor issue. Very satisfied and leaves a beautiful cut.
customer_reviews.author: vs

customer_reviews.title: just buy an automatic mower
customer_reviews.text: i bought this mower in a bundle with a leaf blower. I paid $100 for both. the mower is nice. my 6 year old can push it with some assistance. it takes significantly longer to cut the grass the higher the grass. the negative I have to say is that every little twig, stick, stray mulch piece gets stuck and you have to unjar it with your fingers. someone will get the finger cut off if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or time.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the investment. It mows grass well but if you have weeds or small brush in your yard don't bother. My front lawn has strands of weeds and semi-nicely mowed grass. The blades get stuck on the smallest sticks and twigs as well. I have a fairly normal sized front lawn and I have to empty the bag at least 5 times. You are better off upgrading or buying an electric push mower.
customer_reviews.author: M.Wood

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect. It's easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We are staying out of town on a monthly lease and want to maintain the yard while here. This mower is doing the job perfectly and it was very easy to put together. Snap, snap. Sure it's more time consuming, but it's nice to be out in the yard and spending time in the sun. No cord - no batteries - no gas/oil. It's the real thing au'natural! It's also very nice quality and we will definitely be taking it with us!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Didn't cut the grass, just pushed it to the side.
customer_reviews.text: Had to send this back because after I took it out of the box, read all the instructions and put it together it pushed very hard and made a scraping noise. The worse part was that it didn't cut the grass it just pushed it to the side. So I had to clean it up, take it apart again, try to figure out how to put it back into the box and seal it back up. The only good part was I had Prime so free shipping and free returns and they picked it up on my porch.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Stewart

customer_reviews.title: first push mower ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: after months of reading reviews and going back and forth, i settled on this one... and i'm glad i did. we store it in our basement and we have no trouble getting it up and down. admittedly my boyfriend does the yard work most of the time but when i do use this mower, everything is good! simple to use and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: megs

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easier than a cheap gas push mower for sure! I've got a decent sized yard and I buzzed right through it no problem. If you dont want to have to work a little, get yourself some fancy self propelled monstrosity, but as I said...it pushes easier than a cheap pushmower. Took about 5 minutes to assemble and I was off. It takes a bit to get used to it and how to most efficiently maneuver it, but not long. Havent used the blower yet, but for the price I paid, it could be junk and I'd still be happy with my purchase. Absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Go with a sun joe
customer_reviews.text: This product by the 2nd time I’ve used it doesn’t work the same , the blades aren’t sharpe enough for some reason it’s no where near my other sun joe brand machine . I have a small lawn and I don’t let my grass grow much so I know that’s not the issue. It’s poor quality build and pretty dissatisfied overall with this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go electric instead.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy. Doesn’t collect grass well, hard to cut thick grass and EVERYTHING (in my case wood chips) gets caught in the blade and you have to stop and push it the opposite way to clear it. Even the smallest rock or wood chip will stop all momentum. Have already replaced with an electric mower in less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's O.K. for the money
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy compared to for example the Scott Classic 20" which was bought and returned at the local big box' The front wheel was crushed either because of manufacturer's defect or it was a returned item. The GreenWorks seems made of light sheet metal that bounce along the lawn. It does cut without the grass catcher but doesn't when the catcher is attached. Overall, you get what you pay for an under $100 mowing experience that's acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Apollonius

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! I have about 50sqft of lawn to cut, and don't see the point in using a gas mower. I wish I would have bought this years ago for 1 acre+ yard I used to have. Only think I would say is don't let your grass get too long. It will cut tall grass with no problems, but then you'll have to rake up the tall grass so it doesn't smother your yard. If you stay on top of it, no need to do that. Great mower!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: the only issue is that the catcher is crap and doesn't really stay on
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works well, the only issue is that the catcher is crap and doesn't really stay on, or at least I haven't yet figured out how to get it to stay with my yard, which was abused by gophers. If you have a small yard, this does a good job, not perfect by any means, but it cuts the grass...what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jellyphish

customer_reviews.title: I love my GreenWorks
customer_reviews.text: The GreenWorks reel lawn mower is perfect for me. I needed to mow my lawn, while seated on my power chair, leaving me one hand to push the mower and one hand to maneuver my power chair. I bought the self-propelled mower hoping I would have the strength to push the reel mower with just one hand. I'm happy to report my GreenWorks mower was so easy to push with just one hand! The Greenworks mower cut my grass perfectly. I love the bag that catches the grass. I love the low maintenance, aspect. I'm looking forward to not having to purchase gas, etc to keep my mower moving.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe Rene Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Broke second use
customer_reviews.text: It broke in the second use. Plastic broke at the bottom where I was suppose to graduate the cut..... I’m very disappointed and can not reach the customer support for the new part..
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes Simplicity Is Best
customer_reviews.text: Year after year I would drag my motorized Mower out of the shed, going through a ritual of emptying the bad gasoline from the previous year and cleaning the carburetor and then hitting it with engine start to actually start it, my wife and I decided to buy this ultrabasic mower. So far no problems. It cuts great, no too loud, you are the engine so nothing to break down. Overall, a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yazdi Bellihomji

customer_reviews.title: Useless for tall grass
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to assemble. It doesn’t work on tall grass at all, all it does is push the grass over without cutting. On shorter grass, I have to go over it multiple times because it doesn’t cut evenly on one go. Also, the blower doesn’t even come with a cord! You have to purchase one separately which I wasn’t aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS LAWN MOWER....VERY POORLY MADE AND COMPANY WILL NOT REPLACE OR ALLOW YOU TO RETURN IT
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT FELL APART THE FIRST TIME I USED IT, PURCHASED IT IN APRIL FOR MY NEW HOUSE WHICH I SETTLED ON IN JUNE. WENT TO MOW LAWN AND THE PLASTIC PART TO CONTROL THE HEIGHT SNAPPED OFF AFTER MY FIRST PASS ON MY LAWN AND THEN THE HANDEL BECAME VERY UNSTURDY. I TRYED TO RETURN IT AND BECAUSE I PURCHASED IT IN APRIL AND DID NOT USE IT UNTIL JUNE THEY WOULD NOT REPLACE IT OR ALLOW ME TO RETURN THE PRODUCT. I NOW HAVE A USELESS LAWN MOWER AND VERY UNHAPPY WITH AMAZON AND THIS COMPANY FOR NOT PROVIDING A PRODUCT THAT IS USELFUL AND ABLE TO BE USED.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: I'd only purchase if you have a small yard and not much grass.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty hard to push if your grass is longer but does do the job eventually, You just might have to go over it a few times. I'd say its mainly ment for small yards only. I purchased it for my condo so it does serve its purpose. One thing I dont care for though is the bag that's supposed to catch the grass. It doesnt really do its job that well so took it off and just use my rake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this mower!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, very easy to push, and left the yard looking amazing! It was super easy to put together, and I can carry it with one hand. I got this because I was sick of all the maintenance required with a gas mower. I am very happy I made that choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: Great product while it lasted. We used it 4 times and the forth time the wheel broke off. We thought we’d save money on something like this because we have a small yard. Now we ended up spending more because we’re off to get a gas mower. Save money down the road and buy a good quality mower, NOT this one.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: No gas! But requires endurance
customer_reviews.text: Other than it not always getting the taller blades of grass. This thing is fun.its lightweight and does the job well. Does get a little squeaky after a few uses but wd40 can fix that. Just watch out for sticks. Also the included catcher bag is useful for placing in bald spots in your yard. The grass does die eventually but will leave behind a good amount of nutrients to help grass grow in that spot over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Was septic but figured I’d try it. For the price it can not be beat. It cut my lawn with ease. And the bag actually works I couldn’t believe it. If you have a small lawn this is perfect no gas or oil just push and go. Very pleased with this product and would recommend to anyone with a small lawn who hates the hassle of a motorized lawn mower.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I received the mower (18 inch) without the required screws and nuts to put it together. Went to Home Depot and got the missing parts. Once installed, the mower does a phenomenal job at cutting grass and collecting the cut grass. Do note that if your turf is uneven, it will not be as simple as push and cut... Also, you may need to go over the same places more than once for a perfect cut. However, considering that the mower does not make loud noises, you are able to cut your grass at night time without bothering your neighbors and without enduring a hot sunny day. All in all, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's probably good for a yard with little grass
customer_reviews.text: It works but you have to run if you actually have grass so it'll cut it. I don't know if it's just how these push lawn mowers are but I don't want one anymore. It's probably good for a yard with little grass :( It also won't cut if you're grass is over 2" you'll have to go over the same spot multiple times. If you cut your yard a lot then it might be more beneficial but I don't have time to cut the lawn twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Messer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this lawn mower... I am very surprised by how good it worked. I have used it one time only for now but on very high grass. I had to go 2 or 3 times but it worked very well. I recommend this product to everyone. It is lightweight, very affordable, super easy to assemble, no gas and no mechanic... A dream come true so far. PS: Also the blower adds a great gift to the order... How convenient...
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie Vaglio

customer_reviews.title: Solid mower for the money; Handle could be stronger
customer_reviews.text: Got this mower to keep up with my quarter acre lot and it does a good job, once you get the hang of it. Note that it's important to keep the grass cut short regularly as it doesn't do well once it gets longer. My only suggestion would be to improve the quality of the foam handle. After a few mows, I noticed the foam starting to wear thin and even tearing on one side. Still, this mover is a nice value and great alternative to cutting with petroleum.
customer_reviews.author: RyBehr

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SAUCE!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS MOWER! Needed to have the hay field done once with the big guns my son brought over, but after that it's a BREEZE! GREAT upper body work out :) Easy to push, wheel mechanisms are fantastic, it's lightweight, ergonomic handle, and compared to the old bulky push mowers I used as a kid this is heaven ! I think the so-so reviews come from people expecting mowing the lawn to be a walk in the park. Its not if your out of shape. The small sticks do bind up the blades but it's no big deal to pull them out with a wrench. KEEP HANDS AWAY FROM BLADES! they arrive extra sharp ready to do their job.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: This was a little tricky to assemble as the instructions were not clear, but the mower works like a charm! My 7 year old asks to mow all the time now and because it isn’t motorized, it puts my mind at ease that it is safe for him. Gets the job done well!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rios

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: So this feels tricky for me to review. The mower works perfectly, but its pretty difficult to push if the grass gets too long which I expected. The grass catcher does not like to stay on so I've given up on that! This mower is high quality and definitely worth the price, but if you don't want a decent workout when you mow your lawn then you may not want to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: This Mower is so good for those who have a small yard. It works well. The set up was so easy. I just looked at the front picture, and was able to figure it out. It took, max 30 mins to set up. It can be tough sometimes to use, twigs get in the way, but you can just pull it out. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: daniel park

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product. I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Anyone buying a reel mower does it for there own reasons. Me- it was for the environment and fitness. If you buy this mower you will need to cut weekly. If you have tall weeds it will not cut them. I use my electric weed whacker after I cut. The combo works for me. It's a good product. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brown

customer_reviews.title: What the Cut?
customer_reviews.text: We really like have the reel mowers. We just received the mower a week ago, but it is missing grass. We thought that maybe the blades already needed sharpened, but all the Q/A says like once a year. So idk if we got faulty blades or what. Other than that, it was easy to assemble, it's quiet, easy to push. Oh and I am a 5'3" female and have ZERO issues pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this thinking it probably won't be that great but holly cow it's awesome!!! We have 40 feet of grass and it's perfect. No gas and easy to put together. My husband made me put it together and it was super simple. We didn't attach the bag that catches it to make it easier to steer. Even I can use it easily and mow.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mower for my smallish yard. My yard is relatively flat, with the occasion mole mound. This mower has worked well for the task, it is fairly heavy duty, I've had it for a almost a year now (used 20 or so times) and it remains like new (besides a bit of the remnants of its conquests) It cuts the grass cleanly, efficiently and without the noise of an engine. Its fairly inexpensive for how well it works and how sturdy it seems to be. Highly recommended for people with small yards, who want value, i.e., a good mower for a reasonable price. I've owned a engine-less lawnmower before and this mower, despite being less expensive, works better.
customer_reviews.author: Jonner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for level yards if you are a smaller person
customer_reviews.text: This would be perfect for me (5' 4" 115 lbs) if I was cutting level ground. For me I find it a little hard to push and manoeuvre. The bagger does not want to stay attached. It keeps coming loose and dumping my grass.
customer_reviews.author: Jan a

customer_reviews.title: Only tool I used was the knife to cut the box open.
customer_reviews.text: As inexpensive as this mower was, I expected a huge bag of nuts, bolts, and brackets with a indecipherable instructions. Not the case. The only tool I used was a knife to open the box! There were several main pieces to put together with bolts and plastic wing-type nuts. It's easy to adjust the cut height, too. There may be more precision mowers out there, but if you've got a small area to mow, this is a fine little mower. Hats off to the engineer who designed an inexpensive mower, keeping the end-user assembler in mind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kuehn

customer_reviews.title: Mower blade sticks.  Blower wand didn’t connec
customer_reviews.text: The mower was not easy to push and the blades jammed at the least little thing. The adjustment wasn’t high enough. The blower was nice but the black wand did not snap into place so it didn’t stay attached to the blower.
customer_reviews.author: Lilbritt

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: Looks sturdy enough. My only problem so far is that it did not come with the screws to assemble the darn thing. No instructions either. However it’s a simple assembly. Off the Lowe’s to buy the necessary hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great but gets caught on anything other than grass
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great but gets caught on anything other than grass. And the bag that attendes to the mower doesn’t really hold much. As soon as you stop, the shavings slide forward and fall out of the cradle
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gray

customer_reviews.title: Ideal push mower for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: Great little push mower and blower combo. The blower is awesome and is exactly what I needed. The push mower is great too, the assembly instructions leave a little to be desired. Not entirely clear. I also have a lot of small oak branches and twigs that get caught in the blades which bring the mower to a complete stop. But turning the blade the opposite direction and dislodging the branches isn't a big issue. Overall two great products for one low price.
customer_reviews.author: GordoLeLe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move around and pickup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to move around. Any one can mow a yard with this! I mow mine every Wednesday and never have a problem doing so. Sometimes even look forward to it. Satisfying to see the grass cut so nicely! Haven’t used the leaf blower so I can’t speak on that but the mower is AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cedric P.

customer_reviews.title: Great mower for smaller spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Love my mower. Have a small yard and this is the perfect mower. Didn't want to worry about having gas or plugging in an electric mower for such a small space so I though I would try one of these self propelled type. It is easy to push and with the grass catcher on the back...clean up is a very easy. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No screws or manual included.
customer_reviews.text: There were no screws included to hold everything together. The pieces were thrown in a big box indiscriminately, and no manual was included. It kind've seems like the box was opened because all the pieces had their plastic wrapping taken off. The box was too big for all the pieces. I can't do anything with it since the screws to connect everything is missing. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have around.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great investment. The main reason I chose this item was because I am tired of buying gas, and having to work on a lawnmower every year before we can use it. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the catcher bag is poorly built and came apart after only a couple of uses. Otherwise it's a great lawnmower.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: super small yard
customer_reviews.text: New house, super small yard, might as well get a manual lawnmower before the snow arrives. Really easy to assemble, just a few screws. Mower is a little louder than expected as the blades whirl around. Doesn't seem to give a consistent trim to the yard, so I'm not sure if I'm pushing it too fast or it's just the uneven terrain it's going over? So I seem to have to do two laps around the yard to get everything finally trimmed and not missed even with overlapping passes in each row.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Long

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It mows great but it is incredibly cheap in construction design. It literally fell apart after two mowings. And we were not hard on it at all. Real bummer because it mows great but it is just not well made.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessean

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work well at all! I put back on the box and returned it the same day I opened it. Tried to cut the grass several times and you can’t push it more than 2 feet before it gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy that the cutting level is easy to adjust (don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy that the cutting level is easy to adjust (don't need a screw driver like other reel lawn mowers of this type) but the noise is above and beyond my other reel lawn mower! It's not just a "squeak issue" where you can throw some lubricant at it-it's just in the way the mower's blades cut the grass. I'm not usually one to nit-pick over mowers but I have to wait until all of my neighbors have gone in for the night just to mow my lawn because the noise is so irritating. I like the bag for the clippings but it doesn't catch all the grass as I had initially imagined.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This works great if you need a push lawnmower. It’s lightweight which is great if you have tiered land. I would buy again if I needed one, but I don’t because this one works great!
customer_reviews.author: MoLLyohh

customer_reviews.title: Cuts grass and it's environmentally conscientious!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: You are literally helping make the world a better place by using a "green" lawnmower. Easy to assemble. Very lightweight and easy to use. It's so quiet you can mow the grass at 10 PM without waking the neighbor. It's dirt cheap, provides a slight workout and it's kinda fun to use. Cons: The grass bag fills really fast so I stopped using it. I just blow most of the leaves or leave the clippings as "fertilizer". Your neighbors might be jealous.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: very nice, light weight, easy to use lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: coming from a person who hates to cut the lawn and would really like the chore to be over as soon as possible, this thing is awesome. the only problem is the grass bag is useless. I just took it off and either rake or blow the cut grass. it cuts really well if you stay on top of it. if you let it grow a little too much, it does become more difficult, but overall it works great. just be careful of sticks in your yard if you have nearby trees or bushes. they get stuck easily and then you have to precariously get them out from the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Friends said I'd hate it, but I love it. Getting upper body strength. It's quiet. I do put it on the high setting, unlike most recommenders because I have a lot of broadleaf plants in my lawn and they stay green better when it's higher. Maybe that's the heat and sun of Austin. And at least when it's new and the blades are sharp it's awesome. This and a weed whacker for edges and my lawn is good.
customer_reviews.author: Susannah R.

customer_reviews.title: Go Green, great light weight mower for lawn mowing!  Not  very good for tall weeds .
customer_reviews.text: The mower is better than using a gas mower for the enviroment. Better for use on a lawn not weeds. The strength of the handles is very poor and the grass catcher is difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Irwin

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely suggest this mower, no loud motor or stinky gas. Cuts as fast as you can push, would have given 5 stars but grass seed shoots make it past it by just being bent over and then not cut and it is a little hard to manoeuvre in tight spaces but that's why they make weedwhackers. Great for the price and easy to put together, plus fast shipping makes this well worth it. Seems well constructed so I don't doubt that it will work for a long time to come
customer_reviews.author: ILLEAGLERACER

customer_reviews.title: Great mower at a good price
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted this to be able to use in the more narrow sections of our lawn that the riding mower can’t reach. It works great and we are very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Courde'

customer_reviews.title: But this is fine for small yards where the owner doesn't let the ...
customer_reviews.text: The shipper "Beloved Hero" sent it for free. It works however, for grass that has reached 1' or 8" you might have to use an electric mower. I used this on my dads yard and had to go over it again with the electric lawn mower because of the height of his grass and the size of his yard, I was too tired to keep mowing with this one. But this is fine for small yards where the owner doesn't let the grass get too high.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey W.

customer_reviews.title: More than expected!!
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower is amazing!!! We recently relocated to Italy with the Navy and the house we are renting came with 2 acres of land. We didn’t want to buy a European lawnmower because we are only here for 3 years, so we picked this lawnmower so we could bring it back to the states with us...and what a GREAT product to bring back with us!! We have grass mixed with jungle weeds and this baby just mows right through them!! We took off the grass catcher because it was just filling up too fast. Great buy and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, hard to work with
customer_reviews.text: It was easy for me to assemble it using just one tool and the assembly took 10-15 minutes. Once I started using it, it became a pain. The Bag/Grass Catcher The bag that catches the grass is completely useless. If you're looking to catch grass, do not purchase this product. The bag attaches extremely easy and the same way detaches itself at will. The Mower It does a nice job cutting the grass; however, I had issues with it where it would get stuck randomly and would not continue cutting the grass. I found the solution for it to be to manually rotate the blades in the other direction and that would fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: King Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower. I was nervous about putting together but I watched a YouTube video and it was easy. My 8 year old was able to use it. I got the mower bundle with blower which was easy you plug it up to an extension cord but it is pretty well too. My dog ran around the yard while I mowed within the fence and it didn’t scare her like a normal mowers sound scares her. No burned gas smell you just use your momentum and push. Great workout on a hot day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. $65 was to expensive for what it did.
customer_reviews.text: Does not cut taller weeds. My yard looked horrible after mowing with this item. Just not sharp enough. Had to use my neighbors mower to get my grass to one even level. MAKE SURE YOU RAKE REALLY GOOD. I take and picked up before mowing and the blade was stopped by the tiniest of sticks in my yard that did not get raked up.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie4j20

customer_reviews.title: 30days just isn't enough time to adequately assess a proper review.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the mower/blower right away so I didn't know the cord to the blower was missing. By the time I used the mower it was past the return window. I'm hoping the manufacturer will send me one. : (
customer_reviews.author: Cryztal

customer_reviews.title: Great economical choice
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a perfect little mower for my small backyard. Would not recommend for an average or larger yard. Doesn’t handle longer or thicker grasses/weeds as well as I’d like but it these mowers aren’t really designed to, so it’s very good at what it’s supposed to do!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine N Peeples

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Small wheels broke off after a few uses. Overpriced for such cheap parts. If you have a flat yard this may be a good option but even some very small hilly areas will be difficult. When the big tires can’t tread the blades don’t spin. Due to the cheap build it only works ok on flat yards.
customer_reviews.author: Eman

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel mower.
customer_reviews.text: I love reel mowers because I hate having a garage that smells like gasoline, I have a small yard, and I like being able to cut the grass without disturbing the neighbors. This GreenWorks mower has a nice mowing width, sharp blades out of the box, and is easy to assemble. It works well and there are no obvious drawbacks or flaws with the design or build quality. The bagger could be a little more stable, but I don't use it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Good, good, Green and Great
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing solid mowing on two different yards all season with this puppy. It's not too hard to push and it feels good not having to buy gas all the time. Only a couple problems: the bag fills up in approximately one moment and the smallest of all twigs will clog it. Other than that it's good too go and also super easy to transport. One last piece of advice I have: buy the bigger one!
customer_reviews.author: Dom Jay Gilbo

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 12/2017, Loving it! No more raking!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this for a bit before writing a review. After owning this item for 1.5 years, I'm loving it. At first I wasn't happy, I kept accidentally dumping the clipping on the grass. Now I've got the hang of it. So happy to be free of raking grass clippings.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine DMV

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't cut consistently and all grass clippings shoot to the left side of the bagger and pile up quickly. I had to mow a small yard 5 times just to get everything cut in the bagger was useless. Horrible purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Triplet Dad Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Takes Practice
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good piece of lawn care equipment for anyone wanting to be "green", or just save money by using a no-fuel mower. It will take some practice learning to use the proper push pressure and push angle. The grass catcher can become detached when moving over an uneven surface or tall grass. Also, the blade will spin grass clippings over or past the catch net when pushed too fast, or during a breeze. Expect to spend more time using a reel mower than you would with a gasoline powered mower. But it's worth the extra time and effort if you don't the cost and hassle of a motorized machine, and you want to be more eco-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amber G.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but cuts too low.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and it seems sturdy. My only issue is that I live in Florida and we have that really tough grass. This mower struggled with my lawn in many areas, primarily because the grass was a wee bit high. If only the mower had a higher setting it would be perfect. Its highest setting is REALLY low, which would be a problem with any area experiencing any drought.
customer_reviews.author: Amy McCloskey

customer_reviews.title: enjoy mowing
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and really enjoyed mowing my yard without without the loud noises or smell. Overall I'm very pleased. It did not do great with taller grass but I just hit them with the weed eater and no problem. If the blades stop and you're not sure why there's a stick I promise. Amazing for the price. By the 3rd mow I will save $30 and every moe after thais another $40. My Mom already wants one of her own!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller yard. I'm older,not healthy. I walk slow and kept running out of gas in my mower,so I ordered this for $104. Snapped together easy. I can push it pretty easily, except one section that's sloped a lot. Even my landscaper friend was impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: lisa g

customer_reviews.title: Durable mower, no gas or electric
customer_reviews.text: Love this mower. It's not perfect, but I don't have to worry about gas or electric. Its noisy, but not as noisy as a motor. My kids like to use it too. Only downfall is how easily it can jam up with the tiniest of twigs. But its a quick fix. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not very useful for real lawns.
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if my lawn was just too much for this lawn mower or what but I was very disappointed in the lack of usability and function. It kept getting stuck and did not cut as well as I had expected. For the price I really expected more out of this. I should have just spent an extra $50 for a motor, which I'll probably end up doing now. Except now I'm stuck with a big expensive useless piece of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Cpl. Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job for our small yard. Easy to use and set up. It’s noisy for sure but for the size of our yard, who cares??? Love this and would definitely recommend!!!! I was a little apprehensive at first but when we put it in action it does a bang up job. We sometimes have to go back for a second pass but, it’s easy so it’s no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Amysgreat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard and wanted to try out a more eco friendly mower. This mower is really easy to maneuver. Sometimes small sticks will stop it but I can shake them lose pretty easily. It’s much easier to use than a regular mower too. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

product_meta.title: Greenworks 18-Inch Reel Lawn Mower with Grass Catcher 25062
product_meta.description:
Size:18" DeckFROM THE MANUFACTURER
The GreenWorks products that you purchase have a ZERO carbon footprint. We'll say that again - our entire product line will never release an ounce of carbon emission into the air. 4 Year Warranty - Double The Industry Standard. When looking for lawn tools, we know you're thinking about quality. You're looking for something that will get the job done and get you back to your weekend. That's why GreenWorks backs every tool with a full four-year warranty - we know our products will perform at the highest level and always be reliable. GreenWorks high quality products are manufactured to last. That's why we back every product with a warranty that's twice the industry standard. We'll provide all the power you need without polluting the air or forcing you to keep hauling your gas can to the nearest station (especially in the middle of a mow). No more tune-ups or maintenance. No more emissions. Fifty-four million Americans mow their lawns every weekend, according to the EPA, using 800 million gallons of gas each year. Along the way, homeowners spill more than 17 million gallons of gas while refueling. That's equivalent to the 1989 Exxon Valdez disaster. It's time to move beyond clumsy, harmful gas-powered mowers. It's time for GreenWorks to be your lawn tools for life.
feature_bullets: 18" cutting path gets the job done quicker and more efficiently
2-in-1 feature provides mulching and rear bag capabilities
9 position height adjustment offers a range of cutting height from 1 3/4" to 2 3/4" for the perfect cut on all grass types
10" front wheels and 4" rear wheels makes it easy to maneuver across your lawn
Zero fumes, No Gas, Quiet and Easy to Use for a Green healthy lawn

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,457 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
